question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the code you generate is executable. Implement a visualization dashboard using Vue 3 and Three.js to import a map model, where information at a specific point on the map continuously changes and updates.

checklist.title: Is the Vue 3 integration with Three.js properly implemented?
checklist.description: Check whether the code correctly integrates Vue 3 with Three.js using proper lifecycle hooks (onMounted, onBeforeUnmount) and reactive data management. Verify that component structure follows Vue 3 composition API best practices, with clear separation of concerns. Score 0 if Three.js isn't integrated with Vue at all, 5 if basic integration exists but has lifecycle issues, and 10 if integration is seamless with proper reactivity.

checklist.title: Is the map model import functionality complete?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code includes comprehensive map model loading capabilities: supports multiple 3D formats (GLTF/GLB, OBJ, FBX), implements proper loading progress indicators, handles loading errors gracefully, and optimizes large model performance. Score 0 if map loading is missing, 5 if only basic loading exists without error handling, and 10 if a robust map import system with optimization is implemented.

checklist.title: Is the point-specific data update mechanism implemented effectively?
checklist.description: Assess whether the code implements a system for specific map points to receive and visualize real-time data updates. Check for raycasting implementation to select points, data binding between map points and information sources, and visualization of changing data. The update mechanism should handle high-frequency updates (>1 update/second) without performance degradation. Score 0 if this core feature is missing, 5 if implemented but with performance issues, and 10 if fully functional with optimized performance.

checklist.title: Is the real-time data visualization system comprehensive?
checklist.description: Review whether the dashboard includes various visualization methods for the changing data (e.g., color changes, size animations, particle effects, floating panels with charts). Check if the visualization adapts to different data types and ranges. Verify that transitions between data states are smooth and meaningful. Deduct 5 points if visualizations are basic or limited to text only; deduct 3 points if animations are jerky or distracting. Full score requires at least 3 different visualization techniques with smooth transitions.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as model loading failures, WebGL context loss, data feed interruptions, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. GPU-based data filtering 2. VR/AR view mode 3. Advanced shader effects for data emphasis). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple camera control systems coexisting) 2. Function modules unrelated to the dashboard visualization (e.g., unnecessary social features) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive post-processing filters). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating 3D rendering logic/Vue components/data services), unit test coverage, and build process automation. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the build process is not automated. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size ≥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Click feedback delay ≤ 100ms 2) Transition animation duration controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual focus guidance. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for frame rate drops below 30fps during interactions, and 5 points for camera controls that cause disorientation or motion sickness. The full score is 10 points.
